> 
> I would like a clarification, the tech tree tools will only be for the Dev's and testers right? It looked like some people in this thread thought it was going to be a public feature.

It would have to be in the debug menu or in some sort of special, not-in-game place. There is no way to justify an in-game way to shuffle the requirements for certain items ![:)](//kerbal-forum-uploads.s3.us-west-2.amazonaws.com/emoticons/default_k_smiley.gif)

> 
> Yeah, the decision to bring back the barn was just downright ... suspect considering all the other stuff in the game that could use polish.

Systems like, say.... The tiered upgradable buildings? It's more gameplay driven than many other things. It's the first thing career players see on new saves. Of course it should be good. And 1.0 is going to polish a lot of things. This will not be as short as other ones, not at all. It's a long road to the end...

I think tier 0 needs to come back, the career progression had to be compressed from four steps to three, bigger jumps in mass limit and parts counts than they originally planned for. Some folks have suggested adding even more upgrade steps in between - these wouldn't change the KSC building graphics, but help spread out the overall upgrade expense into smaller chunks.

> 
> I think tier 0 needs to come back, the career progression had to be compressed from four steps to three, bigger jumps in mass limit and parts counts than they originally planned for. Some folks have suggested adding even more upgrade steps in between - these wouldn't change the KSC building graphics, but help spread out the overall upgrade expense into smaller chunks.

Agreed, one of the biggest obstacles in the early career is the stupidly low part limit, yet the VAB/SPH buildings are some of the most expensive to upgrade due to the size of the jump so you have to grind a fair bit just to get the funds to upgrade. A few extra tiers would help even things out, I like the idea of upgrades that utilize the same building model but still give you benefits so you can put in as many tiers as needed. Hopefully Squad will also make this easily moddable and not hardcoded like it is currently.

Interesting historical note: In the real world, the world's first liquid-fuel rocket was launched from [Robert Goddard's aunt's farm](http://www.spaceline.org/history/22.html). It very well might actually have been assembled in a barn, or at least stored in one for a while.

I'll admit it's a bit of a left-field choice, but it might be more *apropos* than some might think ![:wink:](//kerbal-forum-uploads.s3.us-west-2.amazonaws.com/emoticons/default_k_wink.gif)

> 
> Interesting historical note: In the real world, the world's first liquid-fuel rocket was launched from [Robert Goddard's aunt's farm](http://www.spaceline.org/history/22.html). It very well might actually have been assembled in a barn, or at least stored in one for a while.
> I'll admit it's a bit of a left-field choice, but it might be more *apropos* than some might think ![:wink:](//kerbal-forum-uploads.s3.us-west-2.amazonaws.com/emoticons/default_k_wink.gif)

And very Kerbal. I've always thought of Kerbals as being essentially spacefaring rednecks (lead Kerbonauts being named Jebediah, Bob and Bill, a fascination with large explosions, cobbling together makeshift rockets that somehow work despite the odds with minimal thoughts regarding safety), and many of the parts have the description "found lying on the side of the road", which would fit quite well with the barn theme.

That said, I also want the buildings to be moddable so that alternate career progression mods can tweak the buildings as needed and use custom models for the different building levels if desired.

Thank you for that reminder. I reiterate my support for the barn.

The question is, whose is it? Is it Jeb's? We know that Jeb has a junkyard; I'm kind of envisioning here that the barn hasn't been part of a functional farm in quite awhile. Jeb wasn't the farming type and was clearly left this property by his folks who have since passed on. (or maybe they discovered LiquidFuel and moved to Kaliforny after they struck it rich while Jeb stayed behind and used his share to start Kerbin's first space center)

And the rest as they say, is history. (or will be history...)

Oh, and of course he brought his two close friends Bill and Bob in on the venture. And (IMKU) Billy-Boblie Kerman...

FYI, Maxmaps [squadcast of Feb 28](https://forum.kerbalspaceprogram.com/threads/111967-Squadcast-Summary-%282015-02-28%29-Insert-Witty-Edition-Title-Here-Edition) said that:

> Oh, and of course he brought his two close friends Bill and Bob in on the venture. And (IMKU) Billy-Boblie Kerman...

Wait, what about Valentina Kerman ?

(I dont know what you mean by "IMKU" and by "billy-boblie kerman" ; i cannot understand everything since english isnt my mother language ! ![:)](//kerbal-forum-uploads.s3.us-west-2.amazonaws.com/emoticons/default_k_smiley.gif) )

IMKU = In My Kerbal Universe

Billy-Boblie is a possible given name that can be randomly generated by the system. He was in the first KSP game I ever started up. Sometimes I'll re-create him through some save game editing.

> 
> The Barn is being improved a lot, the soul of the models has been preserved, they have to be of the same aesthetic, but the visual quality has been improved. It's not so much a farm any more, it's more of an abandoned military facility kind of thing.

An abandoned military facility would also be an appropriate beginning for a space program, historically both the US and Soviet space programs started out with modified missiles originally intended to carry warheads.

I still like the redneck farm idea though.

I'm hopeful to see what the new barn consists of. I hope it's a nice, flat, wide building with horizontal integration rather than the obvious same-dimensions-VAB-made-of-wood... *thing* that we had before. Nevertheless, I'm still expecting the same thing, as well as the strangeness of Mercury-Atlas level tech coming out of a sounding rocket building.

To be honest, I'd still rather have a converted military complex. It'll start us off a lot closer to the tech level that Squad wants us to start with, and there's no shame in Kerbals being conflict-prone; it's frankly a little more disturbing that they *aren't* given that they're supposed to be easily expendable human equivalents.
